runs.comm: around the wicket on leg stump, tucked in front of short long leg for a quick single
touch short and pulled past mid-on, quickly onto the length, it sat up a little and Myburgh slapped it away
touch short again and this time Myburgh pulls it straighter and again past mid-on
much fuller length and it slides onto the front pad, cry for lbw, probably sliding down
tossed up and Myburgh swings through the line and clubs it down the round, another lovely strike, it plugged a bit but still crept into the rope
push forward and edged but lands just short of Tredwell at first slip
length outside off, Swart plays a silly flick at it without moving his feet and misses
tighter line and beats the bat again, carried through nicely that off a good length, Swart poking at it again with no foot movement
a step across his stumps and pats a fuller ball back up the wicket, Bresnan saves
fuller again and straighter, Swart thrashes it past mid-on, overpitched and the line allowed Swart to get the bottom hand involved to flick it away
touch short and enough width to cut, big top edge lands a few yards short of third man
short and Myburgh goes for a wild hook and misses completely
full and down the leg side
full just outside off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
short and pulled really well, nice controlled stroke and times it past square leg
sliding down leg again, touch of the pad on the way through to the keeper who took it low to his left
fuller outside off and Swart takes a big swing at it that flies off a huge outside edge that whirls down towards third man but lands safely enough in front of the fielder
full length on middle and leg and Myburgh turns it in the air to leg but manages to work is past midwicket and that runs away for another four
more runs, leg side line again and it takes the pad and skips past short long leg, four more
just full of a good length on off stump, tried to be swung over the leg side but mistimed to mid-on
touch shorter and Swart is back to pull, got it high on the bat but in the gap past mid-on and it runs away for a couple
good length angled into off stump, blocked in the crease
big step across the stumps looking for a scoop, Broad saw it and went further outside off stump and Swart couldn't execute the scoop

length on off stump, Swart tries to lift it over the on side but gets nowhere near the necessary connection and chips a catch to mid-on, Stephen Parry claiming a simple chance. Didn't exactly give that the full kitchen sink, went to just raise it over the infield rather than really whack it but got it all wrong
bumper, ducked
around the wicket onto middle and leg, clipped out to deep midwicket
stays around, Barresi looks to turn a full ball to leg and gets a big leading edge that fortunately for him loops over the leaping Tredwell
length ball, Myburgh played right across it and missed but it bounced over the stumps and past Buttler, skidded on a bit that
back and cutting hard past point, touch short that delivery and a lovely shot, waited for nicely
forward to a ball tossed up that turned into the front pad, it pitched outside leg
length ball, forward and turned to square leg
full on leg stump, clipped straight to midwicket
pushed further across the batsman who drives without timing to cover
short and Myburgh sways inside it and uppercuts, bit of a top edge because it goes almost straight over the keeper
full again, pushed gently into the covers
back on a leg stump line and the batsman is a touch hurried looking to flick to leg and gets struck low on the front pad
length on middle and leg, Myburgh can only force it towards cover
length just outside off, Barresi back and cutting out to deep cover
tossed right up, batsman meets it on the full and plays down to long-on
floated up again, flicked out through midwicket and that brings the fifty up
more air, flicked off middle stump to long-on
length on off stump, played gently through point on the back foot but no chance to get back for the second
length just outside off, strong forward press chips it back in the air slightly but nowhere near the fielders

oh dear, nasty short ball which is pulled hard into the deep but straight to deep midwicket where Lumb...drops the catch! Seemed a straightforward chance but he got the jump wrong and ended up parrying it over the rope! Lumb got in a right tangle
firm punch down to long-on
played from the crease but straight to short extra-cover
slog swept off middle and leg and that's way back into the seats over midwicket, nailed it
back foot punch and a fumble from short extra-cover so they'll get a single
flat delivery sliding towards the pad, tucked in front of short long leg and they get an easy run
forward onto middle and off, blocked off an edge to midwicket
goes for the reverse paddle but it bounces and strikes him in the grille!
fuller length, driven back to the bowler where Tredwell does just enough to save the single
floated up, worked off the stumps through midwicket
tossed right up, Myburgh was lining up a big slog sweep again, didn't get all of it and edged out to deep midwicket
down the track and driven to long-off
full, driven wide of long-off and they can get back for a couple
slides onto the pads, tucked in front of short long leg for a sharp single
touch short, Myburgh rocks back to cut and finds deep cover
Barresi gives himself room, Bopara goes wide of off stump and the batsman can't reach it
touch short, pulled out to deep-backward square leg
length on middle and leg, tucked in front of square leg but the fielding is sharp so no single

this turns down the leg side, Barresi had stepped out of his ground and missed it, Buttler whips the bails off in a flash and we'll go upstairs for the stumping. It looks like by a frame, Barresi is back in his ground, just managing to turn around quickly enough to ground his bat
full length turned wide of midwicket for a sharp single
floated up on middle and leg, clipped with solid timing, long-on has a lot of work to do and does well to save four running to his left
more air, batsmen forward and meets this on the full, sweeping to good effect through square leg
forward press into the covers
full length, driven hard but right back to the bowler
forward pushing just past the bowler's left for a quick run and that's the fifty partnership in 44 balls, solid work

oh dear full toss on leg stump, Myburgh wheels it down the leg side but straight to deep-backward square! What a terrible dismissal. A dreadful delivery that should have gone miles but Myburgh has plucked out the deep fielder to perfection who pockets the catch, bad loss for the Dutch, especially in that fashion
full outside off stump, driven at and missed
length ball that slides back into the right hand and beats his attempted forcing stroke on the off side, Buttler can't take it
slower ball outside off, driven out to deep cover
back and clipping a ball just short of a length through midwicket
full just outside off, driven firmly to cover
length ball slides on, Cooper was back and got a thick edge into his pad
forward this time and clipping down to long-on
leg stump and clipped backward of square for a quick single
leg side push for an easy one past midwicket
a brief step to leg and room to lift over extra-cover, nicely timed and in the gap, first four for a while
firm drive back to the bowler who can't save it
full length wide of off stump, driven firmly out to deep cover
slower ball, full length, driven to point
full length on off stump, punched down to long-on
some width offered, batsman takes a huge swing at it and mistimes it back up the wicket
back and cut hard in the air, Broad leaps at point but can't hold onto a one-handed chance, he tips it over the bar but saves four
slower ball on off stump, driven with the angle out to long-on and that brings the hundred up
short ball pulled out to deep square leg
short again, pulled again, low chance to Hales at deep midwicket and he's dropped it should have been taken reaching forward
slower ball, driven off a thick inside edge down to long leg
another slower ball, middle and leg line, turned down to long leg
short, batsman evades it, Buttler jumps and can only palm it, did well to get anything on it, it was miles over the batsman's head
full ball outside off, big swing and a miss
excellent yorker, dug out on the bounce to the keeper
slower on leg stump turned in front of short long leg, quick run
full and driven down to long-on
sets himself for the reverse paddle and missed a ball outside off stump
steps to the off side and paddles to leg, on the bounce to deep square leg
swept hard off the stumps, not much connection, lands well short of the deep midwicket
goes for the reverse paddle again and missed complete again

full of length just outside off stump, swung hard over the off side, in comes Jordan and he holds a blinder! So many put down by England but here, running back, Jordan has reached out with one hand and claimed it superbly. Cooper got it off the toe end
down the track, swings at a length ball and misses completely, it goes over the stumps
a step to the off side and then the leg, swing at a full ball gets a wild outside edge to third man but it lands well short
short, big swing, misses
short just outside off, a gentle uppercut and runs it just out of the reach of a leaping Buttler, nicely played
slower ball, chipped in the air towards cover but well short of the fielder
full on leg stump, just some pad to long leg
length ball, swung down the ground from the crease off the splice of the bat, it runs just past the bowler
step to leg and hit hard to deep cover, just straight to the fielder
short outside off, goes to swing to leg and misses
full at the leg stump, strikes the pad and goes nowhere
excellent yorker, Borren tries to dig it out down to third man but can only find backward point
bumper, too short say the umpires
length, Barresi clears the front leg and tries to swing wide of long-on, Jordan does well but they come back for two
full delivery, a smooth strike with an open face and lifts it over extra-cover and the timing is A1 because that carries for six
full again, tried to go leg side this time but can only find deep square leg
short, Borren ran down the track at it, swiped to leg and missed

full ball angled in at the body, forced down to long leg, they charge back for a second that is never on and this is a run out by miles. But oh dear, Buttler has broken the stumps with his arm before he catches the ball, another silly error from the keeper and Borren survives
full and wide down leg

slower ball, tries to be slapped down the ground but a weak connection and a simple catch to mid-off where Parry takes it on the edge of the circle. Pretty ugly innings from Borren really with that mistimed final stroke summing it up
low full toss, carved to point, Bukhari wanted a single that was never there, Broad didn't go for the direct hit at the non-striker's end...

full and straight, Barresi looks to hit over the leg side, misses completely and the stumps are scattered. It wasn't the perfect yorker but full and straight at pace is often effective enough and so it proved there. Decent hand from Barresi but couldn't take this innings forward for his side
bumper, Cooper tried to scoop it over the leg side but missed completely
goes for another leg side scoop and at least gets something on this, well actually it was flush off the helmet! It runs to square leg and they take a leg bye
follows the batsman who stepped to leg and tried to swing it away over the on side, merely gets struck on the pad and it runs to Buttler
full toss, clothed down the ground, it goes nowhere really but they get a single to finish
